intro: Stenogyne montideae, commonly known as the montidea honeysuckle, is a species of flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and yellow. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, often with a slightly hairy surface. Stenogyne montideae is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments, typically found in montane forests.
